thread.title: Christian McCaffrey is sprinting his way into the Heisman race with 4th consecutive game with 240 all-purpose yards
thread.title_full: Christian McCaffrey is sprinting his way into the Heisman race with 4th consecutive game with 240 all-purpose yards

title: Christian McCaffrey is sprinting his way into the Heisman race with 4th consecutive game with 240 all-purpose yards
text:
Christian McCaffrey is sprinting his way into the Heisman race with 4th consecutive game with 240 all-purpose yards 
Christian McCaffrey is sprinting his way into the Heisman race. Kyle Terada / USA Today Oct 16, 2015 at 12:36a ET 0Shares 
Stanford RB Christian McCaffrey isn't just putting himself into the Heisman race, he's sprinting there. 
McCaffrey, a sophomore, gained 244 all-purpose yards in the first half for Stanford against UCLA on Thursday night, including two touchdown runs and a 96-yard kickoff return . 28-yard TD run by @StanfordFball 's Christian McCaffrey just minutes before we head into halftime! ⚡️ http://t.co/at2UknYKaC — Pac-12 Networks (@Pac12Networks) October 16, 2015 
McCaffrey gained 249 all-purpose yards against USC, then followed that up by going for 303 yards against Oregon State and 260 versus Arizona. The sophomore sensation now leads all of college football in all-purpose yards. true Christian McCaffrey has 244 all-purpose yards in less than a half. #Stanford soph jumping up in the Heisman race tonight. — Bruce Feldman (@BruceFeldmanCFB) October 16, 2015 
As FOX Sports' Stewart Mandel noted earlier this week, McCaffrey's parents, including former Broncos All-Pro WR Ed McCaffrey, may have to start planning a trip to New York. true — FOX College Football (@CFBONFOX) October 16, 2015 
"If Christian continues to put up big numbers and if Stanford keeps winning, their travels may well take them to New York in December..." MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 0
